Reviews.Title: “It's not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: futurestartsslow
Reviews.Content: The good points are the hotel location (5 minutes to the Museum Island, 5 minutes to Unter den Linden, about 20 minutes to walk from Potsdamer Platz, 10 minutes to the Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag) and its brand new rooms. As for the bad points, which justify my 3 stars (in fact, i was choosing between 2 and 3): 1) too close to the train station, can be very noisy (day and night); 2) had to wait for an hour to check-in (i arrived at 4:00pm)- "the room is not ready yet"; 3) got a non-smoking room despite the request for a smoking room when booking; 4) cleaning was average- tables and floors were left dirty sometimes, irregular replacement of complimentary tea and coffee, bath supplies, minibar items; lack of bath supplies (no shampoo); had to wait for an hour for the room service once, when asked for complimentary tea (i got back at 9pm once and found out the cleaning lady didnt bring tea again); 5) no door in the shower- water flows to the floor; 6) safe deposit box in the room wasn't opening properly: it never opened on the first try! you have to press buttons with pressure, so it opens on the second try. If not- it's temporarily blocked for 15 minutes! 7) unstable wi-fi connection (room 511) 8) staff could be more friendly, some staff speaks english VERY BAD- with a strong spanish accent. 9) double bed is just two single beds put together 10) no one helps with luggage 11) charged my credit card with a full amount at the moment of booking 12) at the check-out i was told to pay about 20 euros for the service i didn't use, but the receptionist could say what it was. So i just pay for the minibar items ive taken and refused to pay for this undefinable service. 12) cleaning ladies can wake you up at 9 am, entering the room without knocking. Don't forget to hang up a "do-not-disturb" sign, when go to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: Andreu
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel although it does not provide a 5* lux. services (it's officially a 5* hotel). The hotel is new (opened in 2011) and it's just one minute far from Friedrichstrasse S-Bahn, U-Bahn and regional Trains, which means you are basically connected to every single place of the city including the direct train to Schönefeld Airport. Trains are almost invisible for the customers because the building is perfectly isolated from noise. The services of the hotel are great: a swimming pool at the 8th floor, sauna and gym provides you everything you need for relax. The cafeteria and lobby bar is good enough and the breakfast is excellent. Another pros of location: you're really close to the Museum Island, the Unter den Linden, the Reichstag and the Brandenburg Gate. This is definitely a great hotel. I insist, in my opinion the hotel offers 4* services and 4* price. So it's a good value option. The staff speaks good english and german. There're many spanish trainees thus Spanish speakers could find it a positive point to consider. Additional info: Berlin is not a tradition shopping-city (boutiques and so on) but there're some stores in the same Friedrichstrasse and the Unter den Linden. Supermarkets: There's one excellent supermarket at the Friedrichstrasse, once you leave the hotel's alley on the right. Another option is to buy at the supermarket just you get out of the S-Bahnhof of Friedrichstrasse, inside the station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mandy M
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from a short family break in Berlin. I booked this hotel late so got a very good deal for two rooms. The hotel was very clean and the staff friendly. It was great for both the S and U Bahn for getting around the city. I would definately stay again when I next visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central and contemporary”
Reviews.Author: KnowAll
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for its ease of access from airport (25 minutes by direct train to Friederichstrasse), walking distance to all major sites, plus S-bahn and U-Bahn for further afield. Only a year old and therefore modern and gleaming. We had a very large double bed in our room which did overlook the railway. Noise level not excessive as relatively quiet trains, but used earplugs at night Shower was fantastic with combinations of delivery, though could flood onto bathroom floor if not careful. Surprisingly after only a year bathroom tiling and flooring showing some scratches and discoloring. Good size TV. Rooms were well cleaned. Only met hotel staff on checking in and out, but pleasant and friendly. We did not eat in the restaurant due to the rather high price, but found several breakfast bars within the station (particularly Le Crobag!) and good restaurants both towards the river--Fritz a favourite for German food) and underneath the railway arched along Georgestrasse. Look for a special deal as this makes the hotel very reasonable for its grading

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: OportoSpring2010
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. The most interesting places to visit at a walking distance. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean, comfortable bedrooms. A lot of restaurants and cafés nearby. And a fantastic city waiting for you ... What else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for seeing Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterKdo
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness throughout the hotel is excellent, rooms , lobby areas, toilets, lifts etc. The hotel staff are very friendly and always willing to advise and help to make a stay enjoyable. Well worth taking breakfast as part of the deal as a good food selection to suit everyone. Great shower in a spacious bathroom and comfortable bed and though my room was inward facing I was not aware of any outside noises although I too would not rate the hotel as a top 5 star but a very good city 4 star. A great location in the city enabling you to walk to most of the city attractions on both sides of the old wall structure. Do not miss the free city walking tour. Well sited to walk to lots of local bistros and bars for evening eating and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 1DoppioEspresso
Reviews.Content: The hotell is newly build and modern. We used the garage with entrance from Plankstrasse. It is centrally located within walkingdistance to shopping, unter den linden among other locations. It is also located by a trainstation/u-bahn. Our view from the room confirmed this. Rooms are well soundproofed, but if your a light sleeper i recommend earplugs. The ventilation system makes a bit noise too. I am a light sleeper :-) Breakfast buffet is great. Our room was always nice and clean. The reception could be a lot better in greeting their guests. It is always nice with a Guten morgen and a smile. We stayed for 3 nights. On the day after arrival,after touring Berlin we were outside our room with keys that didnt work. Had to go down to reception to activate. The exact thing happended the next day. We didnt get anything near an excuse. On the second activation I said that I dont expect this from a 5 star hotell. The receptionist just responded this is not a 5 star hotell! Well, she was right. The hotel brochure in room says 5 star, website says luxury?! Dont expect 5 star treatment at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice and quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: trekker243
Reviews.Content: Location - around the corner from the Friedrichstrasse station, walking distance to the Museumsinsel. Perfect for us. No complaints about the service. The room was large and clean with a comfortable bed. We were in an inside room and noted that it was dead silent even as we watched the trains pass by the lobby. We wish the restaurant had free breakfast, but the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: hereweego
Reviews.Content: I spent an enjoyable holiday in Berlin last July in this hotel. I found it modern, friendly, comfortable and good value. Above all, I liked the location, which was 2 minutes walk from Friedrichtsraasse railway station. This was important because Berlin is a vast city, and easy access to public transport helped a lot during my stay. If you like a quiet room, book one facing the atrium. You'll have the use the A/C, but rooms that face towards the train station tend to be noisy. The breakfast was great, and set me up for the day every morning. There was a particualrly good steak-house (can't remember the name) near the station which served excellent food. The hotel lobby had free internet access, though you sometimes had to wait a while for it. Overall I liked this hotel very much and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gastronaut_11
Reviews.Content: Eurostars is a recent addition to the Berlin Hotel scene and is well located across from Freiderichstrasse Station. However, this makes some of the rooms quite noisy, if you prefer to sleep, with the window open. Huge bed, nice bathroom, with rain shower and bath, nicely finished in marble. Overall very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent new hotel”
Reviews.Author: yannaras
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, you feel that the hotel is new in all aspects and everything has been taken care of. One piece of advise: don't go to the bar asking for a drink at 12:01 - the bar closes at 12:00 and flexibility is not an option here. What happened to customer is king?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Charles T
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in Mitte next to both the U-Bahn and S-Bahn trains. Within walking distance of all the main attractions in Berlin. The hotel is very modern and clean. Great internal pool located at the top of the hotel. Breakfast was excellent and the shower was something else! Will definitely stay here again in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-great area- good price”
Reviews.Author: Swedengourmet
Reviews.Content: This 5-starhotel is very good value for money! It is situated close to trains/metro and also to nice shopping areas. The surroundings are very nice and a bit "chic". You'll find e g the French Galeries Lafayettes a ten minute walk from the hotel. Rooms are very big and the bathrooms great. We payed about 120 E /night, which of course isn't cheap, but on the other hand you get what you pay for.The athmosphere at the hotel is very relaxed and friendly. We' ll stay ther again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prespa78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect place,clean and the service perfect but i have to say the internet in the rooms verry bad and the water in the pool ice cold! Maybe because its a new hotel they need some more time to get those things fixed! I rate the hotel exellent because i know next time when i am in Berlin everything will be perfect (i hope)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayCeeAust
Reviews.Content: We got a discount staying here in early Jan 2012 through their website (which had the cheapest rate out of all the travel discount websites). We were in the perfect location, really close to Friedrichstrasse train station which is surrounded by some nice restaurants. Also you can get to the Schonefeld Airport directly from this station in 25 minutes, which was perfect (as we had a very big night before we had to fly home). The hotel has a beautiful pool on the top level which is heated and is surrounded by palm trees for a tropical feeling (which I missed so much being in EU winter from Australia). The staff were new so it took a while to check in, but they were so friendly and asked for our preference for which room we should stay in. The only draw back is that half of the rooms face inward towards the reception and into each other (like a Bentham Panopticon Prison), while the other half face outward (we luckily got a room facing outward over the train lines which was beautiful!) Free Wifi which was essential when we were booking out trip and the rooms were brand new and clean clean clean. One of the best parts of our trip! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Extrenely friendly and clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: dannyb343
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eurostars in December 2011 to take in the sights and visit the Berlin Christmas markets. The hotel is very easy to find, a stones throw from Friedrichstrasse Station (which is very easy to get to from Berlin Schonefeld Airport). Our flight landed at 0830 from London so we got to the hotel well before check in; the staff on reception took our bags and kept them safe for us while we headed out to the city which was great. Lots of restaurants and fast food joints extremely close-by so no worries in terms of choice (turn right on Friedrichstrasse toward Unter den Linden and you have Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts; left and you walk towards steakhouses, chinese restaurants and theatres). Room was extrenely clean with a lovely view. Bar was always very well served and a nice place to sit after a meal out. Only negative is the price of the breakfast (25 euros each per night!!!!), we just popped down to starbucks for a coffee and hit a local bakery instead, Lovely place, good value, don't bother with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent because...”
Reviews.Author: nickp26
Reviews.Content: I' ve been to a few places and stayed in various hotels mostly 4 stars and some 5 ones.Eurostars is said to be a five star hotel.I read some reviews saying that its at most a 4 star hotel.I say its a 5 minus hotel and this because of minor things.Some of these are soundproof of the rooms(some noise of the rooms aside and the train) and also maybe not so much quantity regarding the breakfast buffet.For me these are seriously minor stuff. Location in Berlin is the most important thing in your visit.Eurostars has the BEST location you can imagine.First outside the hotel and in a 2 MINUTE walk there are U and S Bahn (aka subway and train) that lead to the most central places in Berlin.Two stops from Alexanderplatz ,three stops from Halleshes Tor which is the station where you can take the U1 to Charlottenbourgh and east berlin across east side gallery.If you dont want the subway Eurostars is a ten minute walk to the MUSEUM ISLAND(including 5 museums and two of the best museums of the world the Pergamon museum and the east cultures museum), a ten minute walk to Checkpoint Charlie, a ten minute walk to the Brandeburg gate,Parliament and Tiergarten park and also a fifteen minute walk to Alexanderplatz which includes the TV tower and some churches to see.So some say the location of the hotel is great.I say its the greatest that can be.And in Berlin this is the most important thing. Regarding the hotel itself.Its a great building with very beautiful design inside.The staff of the hotel is very kind and helpfull.They can book some tickets for you(ask for a booking to the TV tower).The rooms are big enough and very clean with everyday cleaning and a bathroom with villeroy-boch and bathtub included. Regarding price.We booked for 5 nights for 580 euros breakfast included.Thats a normal price for a new and clean hotel.Keep in mind that there is FREE WIFI with good speeds when in other hotels(etc Hilton ) is almost 20euros a day.So the price is seriously good for a big city with lots of tourists. All in all a great hotel on a perfect location and i would really highly recommended it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “New, modern & clean. Great location”
Reviews.Author: gzbike
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 5 nights after Christmas at this Hotel. Booked it because of the good ratings and the location in the area we wanted to spend most of our time. I was not aware that it is this close to the subway and railway line which is one of the best benefits. Basically just 100m from the subway line. Also the hotel is very new, modern and generally very clean. Staff is friendly and generally helpful, though my experience with the check in staff wasn't that great as she could have shared a lot more information and answered questions better. The other staff were a lot more helpful when approaching them. Breakfast was good but the restaurant got very crowded however space got quickly available should there be some waiting prior seating required. Car parking space is also very limited and the hotel staff can not reserve or guarantee space. But there is ample of parking opportunities around the hotel for same or even less charge. Would for sure stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location but be carefull with your credit cards!!!!”
Reviews.Author: marina t
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my husband 23 -26/12/2011.The location is perfect and the room is very good. Although I made a reservation that did not required payment in advance they tried to be payed before I got in the hotel.I knew this when I booked the hotel(from another review!) and that is why I gave them an invalid card, because I wanted to pay in cash. In few words , when I checked in, they asked me 50€ more for guarantee because I didn't have a valid card and they would give it me back when I was going to leave the hotel. When I checked out they did not recognize that I gave them guarantee!!!!After yelling for many minutes they gave me my 50€ and the manager told me that she is paying this money from her salary!!! For the end, DO NOT PAY FOR THE BREAKFAST!! There are plenty shops around the hotel where you can get anything much more cheaper! Great location again!!!We didn't need any transportation for all our sightseeing!And clean room!But be carefull with the money please!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Even better location”
Reviews.Author: Maildeshere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a small family of 4 (3adults and a 3yr old) over 4nights and although the temperature of Berlin was at its coldest this winter, the hotel staff and facilities made it warm and cosy. We did no try the breakfast as the variety of food you get within minutes from walking out of the lobby is enormous. The S-Bahn is literally just next door (you can see the trains coming into the station from some of the room windows) and there is a McDonald's below it for those craving for a familiar breakfast in the morning. Bratwurst, other standard german faire all within a stone throw away. The extra bed was a full size single which is way better than the standard roll aways you get even in some of the best 5star hotels. As comfortable as the queen or king bed just smaller.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Berlin......”
Reviews.Author: Rob G
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before travelling on to Poland, so wanted a good central Berlin location and comfortable accomodation. We were not disappointed!! The room was amazing, huge comfortable bed, full mini bar with reasonable prices and an immaculate bathroom! We had breakfast included and went down fairly late, expecting there to be very little left. This was not the case, there was still an exstensive selection, keeping us full for the journey to Poland. Exceptional hotel for a good price!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, new, good price”
Reviews.Author: Reisaapie
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night while on business. We had a great rate through my business, at 110 euro. night including breakfast. Rooms are nicely equipped, nothing exciting, but very good quality overall. The bar area is not very cosy. The breakfast was great, large choice of cheeses and cold cuts, breads, juice, egg. The cereal was less exciting and only had the kellogs one serve boxes. would defintely recommend this, the friedrichstrasse station is 50 meters away and brandenburger tor a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent service, beautiful rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: taraship
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, right next to the train station. One would think that would be a disadvantage (noise-wise) but it was never an issue. A tiny bit hard to find if you are weary after traveling but just ask someone. You can see the sign from several blocks away but not great if coming just out of train station. Anyhow, they have an amazing desk staff and the breakfast...unbelievable. Seriously, unbelievable. Everything you can think of and I often ate enough to keep full through lunch. The rooms were super comfortable and clean. Bathroom was huge. Restaurants all around, whether you want cheap or something fancier. Museums right around the corner. I can't say enough about how great this hotel was and, to top it off, a very decent price for the location. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterDaisy
Reviews.Content: Booked via last minute secret hotels. Fantastic location just opposite the Fredrichstrasse train station. (Take the express train from Schonefeld airport direct to Fredrichstrasse station - in 30 minutes you will be in the hotel). The hotel is set back from the main road. Under the railway bridge with MacDonalds on your left - see alleyway opposite for the hotel, behind Block restaurant. Lovely clean, new hotel. Easy walking distance of the sights - 10 minutes to Brandenberg gate. Restaurants, shops and supermarket all within easy vicinity of the hotel. Reception staff friendly and helpful and a fabulous breakfast. Free wifi. The only points would be that the bed was huge but not overcomfortable. We were in an outside room and with the window open we could hear some trains. It did not disturb us but if you want to avoid this you could ask for an inside room.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jen1232
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a lovely time. When we arrived we were told that our reservation had been cancelled. We explained that this should not have happened and they dealt with it quickly and without causing us any distress. It was clean and comfortable and the service was great. We ordered room service 2 nights and were very impressed. We had a small issue with this the second night, but the problem was sorted as soon as we alerted them to it. The location is fantastic and there are lots of shops and resturants close by. We were a little worried that it was very close to a train station, but were not bothered by any noise. We would have liked the pool to be heated. Overall a lovely stay and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “For sure not a 5* Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AndyRandy
Reviews.Content: I don't know who has rated this hotel to be a 5* hotel but it is far away from that, no service at all! I would say it is a good 4* Hotel on a good location, all is new so not much to complain... just do not expect 5* service!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: tlcmaley
Reviews.Content: Eurostars Berlin is a new hotel and is so convenient for walking access to former West Berlin and "East Berlin" on the Friedrichstrasse shopping area. It is therefore very convenient to shops, restaurants and all public transport. The hotel rooms are very comfortable, bed extremely so. All staff are wonderful. If you are on an outside room, earplugs would be good if you are used to complete quiet. The rooms are not noisy but you can hear a rumble of a train going by although it didn't disturb me. Lighting in the room was soft and it was a little difficult to see the clothes on shelves. The bathroom had Villeroy and Bosch fittings and was spacious. Although if the side jets were used on the shower, they flooded over the walk-in-shower onto bathroom floor. More towels needed. This is nit-picking. Buffet breakfast was included for us and the choice gave you everything. One day eggs were cold and served coffee a bit strong/bitter but there are coffee machines andhot water urns, tea pots and many kinds of tea to choose from. The gym is small, but how many excercise bikes does one need?! Pool is cold. The lobby bar is small but the staff compensate with their friendliness and good service. When next visiting we will definitely stay at Eurostars again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that lives up to its 5* rating!”
Reviews.Author: Citybreakers2
Reviews.Content: Booked this for a 2-night city break and our only disappointment was that we hadn't booked to stay longer! The hotel is modern, immaculate and has beautiful rooms overlooking a high-tech central courtyard area. The bathroom was spacious and spotlessly clean. Worth mentioning was that the room was one of the quietest we have ever stayed in - no noise from the corridor outside or from the courtyard Breakfast was superb, with a great selection of quality hot and cold food. Our only criticism of this hotel was that the restaurant was short-staffed at breakfast. We walked in at 9.30am to find no tables had been cleared and had to wait 10 mins until a table was eventually set for us. This hotel is in a convenient location - directly across the road from the station on the Friedrichstrasse. If you are flying into Berlin airport take the train into the city centre - 3 euro as opposed to 35 euro for a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied and will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Berniebobcat
Reviews.Content: We had just one night at the Eurostars Berlin, and I would actually rate it at 5 stars to be honest. The only reason I held back, and gave it an overall 4 stars is that we did not get to sample either the restaurant or the leisure facilities. The location was superb. Right beside the train station at Frederikstrasse, which is intersected by several lines. The shops along this street are also fantastic and we were within a few minutes walking distance of Unter den Linten. The hotel was spotlessly clean and everything looked fresh and new as if it was only open a week! The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our bed was very comfortable and large with lovely soft linen. The shower was good and the range of toiletries left for us was very good, even including a comb and a shoe buff. We were in one of the rooms on the 5th floor overlooking the train lines. With the windows closed it was nice and quiet, and we were not disturbed when we were sleeping which initially I had been a little concerned about. The air conditioning was easy to work in our room (and it worked well) which was very important given that we had to keep the window closed. The safe was large enough to accommodate a laptop, and easy to use. There was tea/coffee making facilities in the room, which was great for getting us started in the morning, given that we did not have breakfast included in our room rate. The bathroom was beautifully tiled, and I also loved the wooden effect floors, which were so much nicer than some of the grubby carpets you see in hotels that are even just a few years old. We had some wine at the bar in the evening (a little pricey at 6 euro for a small glass) but it was very nice, and we were very impressed with the friendly and attentive barman who looked after us. There were two computers available in the lobby for guests to use, and we had free Wifi in our room also. (Wifi reception was not so great in the room, but downstairs my husband was able to use his iPhone all the time). I couldn't say a single thing against this hotel and I would highly recommend it for anyone wanting to find their way around Berlin on a first visit, as being so close to the station made life very easy. I would like to have sampled the food there, but for brunch we ate at the little cafe just beside the hotel, at the entrance to the train station. We bought a bottle of water, a roll with ham and cheese and a pizza slice, and it was just over 6 euro! Great value and very tasty. Finding the hotel was made easy by the directions left by a previous reviewer, and just to reiterate, the hotel is found by crossing under the railway bridge opposite Mc Donalds, and walking down the lane to the side of Block House restaurant. Without those instructions I think we might have found it a little hard to find. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: Ralli22
Reviews.Content: stayes there 6 days in Septtember. Service okbrand new hotel with all 5 star faciliteis , good WLAN reception, rooms clean but shower gel was not always replaced empty mini bat bottles not collected. Breakfast disorganized ( personall) but quality good Location as good as it gets, unbeatable

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, absolutely superb location”
Reviews.Author: Patrick004
Reviews.Content: For a first time visit to Berlin, this was a really good choice, being so well located, indeed exceedingly well located. We found the staff friendly and willing (without being superb). We just could not get the hang of the air conditioning - reported it, someone came up who thought he had resolved it and said it would come into effect 10 minutes later; 10 minutes later to his credit he rang to enquire if it was now working ok; unforuntately it was not, so although he was willing to come up again, we said forget it. We went on a bank holiday weekend (reunification day was on the Monday), so despite booking through Last Minute - secret hotels deal, it was not very cheap, but nor was it expensive. Berlin is easily the best city I have ever visited, and we are booking to go again for another 4 nights in March

Reviews.Title: “Boa localização mas decerto não corresponde a um hotel 5 estrelas”
Reviews.Author: _Bu_viajante
Reviews.Content: Positive points: location, near rail and tube station, size and design of rooms. Negative points:1) at breakfast they didn't replace scrambled eggs even after asking twice! After the third complaint, they replaced it. Not a wonderful breakfast, but a decent one. 2)there was a fly inside the room!!! It woke me up at night and I needed to kill it myself! Nasty! 3)we booked a celebration break which contains a bottle of cava and strawberries with chocolate but when we arrived there wasn't anything waiting for us. We complained at first night by phone and needed to complain again Next morning to get it... 4) the shower glass is so small that the wc gets really wet after any shower you take. It's quite good the shower but you need to dry even the door of bathroom after it.5) housekeeper didn't replace soup and coffee milk 6) we stayed at Eurostars das letras in Lisbon last year and staff was incomparably better... Don't know if it's the same owner, but this Berlin hotel needs to improve!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: shinebow
Reviews.Content: The location is very very good. Its near a station which a lot trains and tubes pass by. Its also in city center and near popular spots. The room is comfortable and clean, although the decoration style is very old. The only problem I met was the water of temperature in shower room is not hot enough.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break in berlin”
Reviews.Author: TheBankerDoctor
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right in the centre of berlin, and next to a station that has many train lines. Triple room actually has three beds in it, as oppose to other hotels that say a roll-out-bed is available, at a surcharge!! Sauna and swimming pool included in the price, but I would have expected a jacuzzi as well. English speaking friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnBLiverpool
Reviews.Content: To find the hotel, go under the rail bridge on Friedrichstrasse with McDonalds on left. Go down side of Block House restaurant. (Great Steaks!) Hotel brand new and a little soulless, but well equiped and comfortable. Walking distance to major sites of interest. About 4+ stars. The bar drinks are a fortune. Diplomatico rum (My fav), 18 euros a shot! Found staff friendly and helpful. Lots of decent restaurants under rail arches. Very good breakfast buffet. All in all, a good week.

Reviews.Title: “Good location / Bad service”
Reviews.Author: castilhos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, relatively close to the areas of interest and in front of a subway station. Despite its central location, the rooms are well insulated and one do not hear any noise once inside. On the terrace you can find a sauna, a gym and a swimming pool with panoramic city views. However, despite its great potential, the hotel's service leaves much to be desired. At the swimming pool and the sauna, the used and dirty towels piled in a corner. In the rooms, used cups and glasses were not changed in the next day. Finally, when we asked the concierge for a restaurant for dinner, he suggested us an awful place. The next morning, when we went to the reception to complain about the restaurant, other customers were doing the same. Despite all the criticism, the staff proved to be arrogant and disinterested. If you are searching for a good location, but do not worry too much about a high quality service, the hotel might be a good option. But I would look for a little more, maybe you will find other options, with better prices, in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “New 5* hotel in Berlin,good location but not for families”
Reviews.Author: MaturemanL
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the new Eurostars Berlin on a business trip with clients and colleagues.Service was good,facility is brand new and therefore rooms are in good condition and modern.Breakfast buffet was extensive.Location is also excellent on the Friederichstrasse with transportation and restaurants within walking distance.On the other hand the hotel has the soul of a train station with a very much "convention type" feel to it and therefore not reccomended for families on holiday.Paid 219 Euro for B&B with free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: Myself77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, has decent price, friendly staff. Bus, subway and taxis right around the corner. Not that you need it, you can walk almost anywhere from the hotel. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: martin_ww
Reviews.Content: This fairly new hotel is located directly next to Friedrichstrasse Station, offering excellent public transport connections, and also within walking distance of the Berlin central views (Brandenburg Gate, Unter den Linden, Reichstag, Museum Island, etc). You can't get much better that this in terms of convenience to explore the city. No need to worry about traffic noise, the hotel has some of the best sound-proofing I have experienced. The reservations and the welcome was very professionally handled. We were early for our rooms. Our luggage was stored, though not delivered to our room. Our standard room was spacious and comfortable, the bathroom equally spacious and functional. Staff are friendly. So, all major points deserve a positive rating. Still, the general ambience of the hotel (functional rather than luxurious), the no-frills bar, the crowded and busy restaurant, the standard of the breakfast buffet all indicate a good four-star standard rather than five-star. As such, I don't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “eurostar berlin”
Reviews.Author: LorenzoRossetto1979
Reviews.Content: I suggest you to stay at Eurostar berlin. the value for money has been ok. good position (it's taken 5 min from the hotel to Brandeburg Tor ). Spa area is small but clean and useful- Good hotel. Staff polite and reliable. staff speaks many languages ( such as italian , strange enough abroad ). Near the Hotel there is Fredrichstasse banhof , convenint for sightseeing the cuty and the neighborhoods. I think you'll be satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with wonderful bathroom”
Reviews.Author: susanne255060
Reviews.Content: Situated just 3 minutes walk from Friedrichstrass railway, this very modern hotel was a delight. Service was helpful and charming, the room spacious, tastefully decorated with huge windows giving plenty of light. Also included was an iron, ironing board and tea/coffee facilities - joyful!! The bathroom was spotless, the plumbing faultless and able to be understood without a degree in structual engineering. It was close to up market shops and about a 15 minute stroll to the Brandenberg Gate. We booked online and found the cost to be value for money. Definitely one for a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very far from 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Ostbur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually stay in 2 or 3 star hotels when travelling. Our expectations were therefore high when we booked a double room at Eurostars Berlin (5 stars). The hotel is new and elegant and is very favourably situated in central Berlin, but a bit tucked away in a narrow alley although close to Friedrichstrasse and Friedrichstrasse railway- S- and U-Bahn-station. The room was OK and the breakfast opulent and meeting most demands one should think. Our first disappointment came after having checked in: There was already luggage in the room we got and clothes on the bed. Our immediate thought was that the previous guests had had to leave in a hurry and might have forgotten some of their things in the room. I therefore rushed down to the reception to inform them of this possibility. Then they found out that “our” room was in fact already occupied! Very embarrassing! A good thing though the occupants didn’t arrive as long as we were in their room! Yes, we got another room, but a rather modest excuse. The receptionist gave us the impression that such things happen! But this was not all. The breakfast was between 6.30 and 11, which means that the cleaners normally would wait until about 11 before wanting to clean the room. Here they knocked on the door at 10 wanting to know if we wanted to have our room cleaned. Of course we did, but not if that meant that we had to leave the room immediately, which it obviously meant. Normally the hotel personnel is discrete and wait until they know a room is empty before starting to clean it. Another day we came back to our room at 5 p.m. to have a nap, which has been possible in all other hotels we have stayed in. We noticed that our room was not cleaned and shortly after the maid came and wanted to do her job – at 5 p.m.!? We also have to say we were not overwhelmed with excitement over a shower that is so modern that one needs a technical course to operate it. My wife wanted to wash her hair and had to sit on the floor using one of the lower taps since none of us was able to get the highest one to work!

Reviews.Title: “goof hotel, good location - not enough exprience”
Reviews.Author: udias
Reviews.Content: the hotel is new, locaterd in the heart of berlin, excellent breakfast. we stayed at junior suite, which is ideal for famile with small children. the staff is very polite and nice (also speak spanish-the hotel belongs to spanish chain). but, most of the staff has not enough exprience. for example: the room wasn't cleaned every day until we asked for it, the sink didn't work and also the TV. the indoor pool is very small. to conclude - i recommend this hotel. with some improvment it can be excllent. now it is very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: supertopfit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to a metro station, Friedrichstrasse and the river. It s ideal to discover the city. The rooms are nice, clean but quite small. The Breakfast is very good but not at the standard of 5 stars hotel The price is actually ok for the quality of the room and the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SuzDundalk
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location just bedise Friedrichstasse s bahn which connects directly to both airports. Probably more a 4 star than a 5 but good value for money. The rooms are a good size and clean. Service was good and the staff friendly. Breakfast was included in our rate and was a very nice buffet. Its a ideal spot for touring the city, right beside the s-bahn station (even if it is hard to spot at first), about 2 minutes walk to unter den linden and another 5 minutes to the Brandenburg gate. A great hotel in a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Just brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Max2502
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel notwithstanding some conflicting reviews about it. This is a brand new hotel right in the heart of the action, and just outside the Friedrichstrasse S and U Bahn stops. This is critical as this stop can get you almost anywhere very quickly. I arrived a bit early but the room was ot ready so I had to leave my bags and come back later. Service was sutiably apologetic and courteous. When I did return and checked in, I was dismayed to find that my specific request for a king size bed had been ignored, getting 2 singles instead. I was given the option to upgrade to the Junior Suite (at a cost) and elected to do this. It was a stunning room and I'm glad I did. Incredibly spacious, with all the trappings of luxury you could want. My only gripe would be that the windows that look into the hotel atrium did not have a good enough blockout, letting in light too early in the morning. The hotel food was excellent and very reasonably priced. I found this place to be excellent value, superbly located, stunning room, with courteous and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: bernardjhayes
Reviews.Content: At the price this hotel charges .look no further and book before you miss out .cleanest room I even left a tip for the cleaners.great size room .great no better than great location.great breakfast this hotel would be in the to ten in any city.all I say missout and pay a whole lot more somewhere else.I stayed six days always the same.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in a Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: gjohnsonwest
Reviews.Content: Located across the street from the Friedrichstrasse S Bahn and U Bahn station, one of the best things, if not THE BEST about the hotel is its amazing location. We could access any part of Berlin with ease either by train or on foot. Also, because the hotel was brand new, the rooms were spotless and on the whole quite nice. Other reviewers complained about the staff, but we found them to be amicable and helpful, for the most part. Overall, this was a very nice hotel at a very fair price in a wonderful location. While this is not what Americans would consider to be a five star hotel, it definitely is worthy of a four star ranking.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClonmelTipp
Reviews.Content: I booked the Eurostars Berlin for a city break in Mid July. I checked in advance to confirmed it was a double room and my room was a twin bed room. I have an email witht the details. Went down to reception and was advise all the double rooms were booked out and I that I should come back in the morning at 8am. Being away for a break I was not getting up at 8 am.I went to the leisure center one night at 8.30pm for a swin, closing time was 9, dirty towels everywhere and no clean towels for me. The hotel is in a great location and everything is walking distance from the hotel and easy access to public transport and the airports. The staff were lovely but this is not a 5 star hotel, it lacks the extra touch that you get from 5*

Reviews.Title: “new hotel but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: thefitter60
Reviews.Content: rooms are not cleaned very well.shampoo bottle left on the bathroom floor was still there after room had been cleaned could not got wifi in room (no 712) had to go to lobby room not very big all hallway.no information about facilities or city in rooms the swimming pool is not heated would not use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Sensational 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: guy_from_downunder
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 3 nights knowing from Tripadvisor that it was a new hotel with teething problems. The location of the hotel is as good as one will get in Berlin. The rooms are nicely fitted and the breakfast was of a very high standard with great variety. The free internet was welcome, albeit I needed to log in each time I opened my computer or iPhone. The staff were pleasant, albeit lacking experience. I am not sure how it is rated 5-star given that it is not large and does not have the trappings usually associated with 5-star. This is not a criticism, but people looking for a true 5-star opinion may be disappointed. Would gladly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Ok but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RichandCarmen
Reviews.Content: I booked the Eurostars Berlin at least a month before I travelled. Once I eventally found the hotel I checked in confirmed it was a double room and my room was a twin bed room. Went down to reception and was advise all the double rooms were booked out and I that I should come back in the morning between 10 to 12. Now for any travellers who are on holidays there is no way we are missing out on siteseeing to change our room. Went back the next day in the evening after we came backand was told again there is no double bed available. During our stay we also encounted no towels in our room and hubby found hair in his breakfast. We found the staff to be average as I had to go to reception twice to request a map of the local area and wifi logins this should of been automatic once you check it. Overall we didn't enjoy our stay here at all Breakfast was OK the same everyday but nothing flash. I wouldn't stay here again as there are cheaper hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CRose8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in May 2011 with friends. A good location in the theatre and restaurant district, very close to the Fredrickstrasse S/U station giving good connections to this spread out city. Walking distance to the Brandenberg Gate,etc. So it is well placed and parking in the U/G car park is not too expensive. A brand new modern hotel, large rooms and plenty of space, everything you need for a city break. The breakfast buffet was excellent, something for everyone and included in the room price, something I haven't seen much in Berlin. The bar in in the large atrium and well priced, we didn't eat here because the staff were able to recommend 3 great places to eat nearby and with a supermarket 2 minutes away, we just didn't need too. So why only 4 stars then.. For all its good points Room cleaning was slow, we went out all day getting back at 5pm and our room still had not been serviced. We mentioned it, the next day it had been serviced by the time we got back, but all the dirty bedlinen had been left thrown in the corner and the glasses not cleaned or put away. Being a new hotel not all the support was in place, e.g. there were no drinks menus for the bar. It was a good price and I will go here again I hope they have sorted out those few teething problems and don't put up the price too much. The two places to eat.. the Blockhouse (Steaks etc) 2 minutes walk right by the hotel. best steak I have had in 2 years. 12 Apostiles 5 minutes walk (Italian) under the railways arches, but you wouldn't know it and great pizza's (don't go large - it won't fit on the table).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Great Value. Friendly and very Attentive Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Elpa_Cork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June. Excellent location less than 5 minutes walk from Frierichstrasse railway station in the heart of the theater and restaurant district. Very good value for money for such an upmarket hotel. Staff were very courteous and helpful at all times. At midnight when we had returned to our room and had some difficulty setting the room thermostat to a desirable temperature , the staff even offered to change us to another room if the temperature was not to our satisfaction within a short period. This is what I call excellent service. We would most certainly recommend this hotel as a great location and for it's excellent value and friendly stall. Thank you and well done to all. (Liam & Patricia)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommandable”
Reviews.Author: Hansiman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eurostars for 3 nights on a business trip. Brand new, clean, spacey rooms. 50 meters away from station Friedrichstrasse. Free WiFi. Breakfast buffet was also good. I paid around 80 euros per night and that's cheap for this kind of hotel. I don't have a clue why this hotel is ranked so low in Berlin. The only thing negative (if you really looking for something to complan about) is the fact that being a Spanish hotel, the TV has 20+ Spanish channels... This is a very good hotel; I would recommend this hotel to any business traveller or everybody who's planning a city-trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: 2011DC55
Reviews.Content: Great location, very nice hotel and at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel”
Reviews.Author: NaokoJP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eurostars Berlin for 5 days in early May with my husband. It's really brand new hotel and located in the very central of Berlin, just in front of FriedrichStrasse S/U station and there is a super market REWE nearby(basement) very convenient for something. Twin (two beds pushed together) was very comfortable, bath room with bathtub/shower combined was very clean and spacious. By the way, there is speaker fixed in bath room so that you can enjoy the music or listen to TV news or others, a phone set provided as well. The breakfast was excellent, it's buffet style,there were many variety kinds included hot, cold, fruits, salad, soft drinks of course many kinds of coffee. The staff in front desk speak Spanish as main language (I supose) because they talked to their colleagues not in German but Spanish as normal. We requested a twin room when we checked in, because they provided double room ( a big bed with one blanket), we took quite a while to get through due to English is not good enough for them to communicate nor German my husband speaks German. The higher floor is right choice, bcz from 1st to 5th(?)floor some rooms are facing inner lobby, the window just can open very very limited and not fresh air from out sight. It still remans polish chemical smell in the room.( #216 was allocated but we refused, and requested to change another room). Wonderful location for visiting Berlin to every conner, that's a big PLUS.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel, in a fantastic position”
Reviews.Author: Diggeo
Reviews.Content: This is a nice 5 stars, modern hotel, on the Friedrichstraße, near Unter den Linden, close to the historical center of ex East Berlin and the main monuments of the city. Also it is in a 5 minute walking distance from the airport express' station. It is part of a Spanish hotel chain and the stuff (which consists mainly of Spanish), is extremely polite and willing to serve. We stayed there during the Eastern holidays. Our room οverlooked to the reception area and out of it, as all the façade is from glass. The view isn’t something special – we were seeing the trains on the Friedrichstraße station, but no noise was heard inside. Rooms are spacious, with free w-fi and stylish decoration. Breakfast, without being exceptional, had a rich choice of food, but with little variety of fruits. The hotel has spa, gym and other services, but we didn’t use them. In general a decent hotel, fantastically located, at a reasonable cost (120 Euros for twin room).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: bookpublisher3
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed a weekend break. Excellent buffet breakfast and good-value evening meal. Very well situated near a public transport hub, the museums and central Berlin. The beds were the best part; though we could hear trains, they did not disturb. I had a solo swim in the pool, with its view over the cityscape; but once just three other guests arrived, the pool felt crowded. The designer of the central lobby has made many rooms semi-internal (unnecessarily, imho). The scale is a little small compared to the expectations of a five-star: there are no luxury boutiques, no variety of bars and restaurants. but then we weren't paying a five-star price either.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: ElkeTom
Reviews.Content: We had 2 wonderful days at Eurostars Berlin. Location is excellent, next to train station Friedrichstraße, about 10 min walk to Brandenburger Tor. Quiet room. Room was very well equipped, bathroom with shower only, but quite large. Breakfast buffet was excellent, great selection. - During rush hour there can be waiting times in breakfast room. - Cleaning team forgot shower gel of previous guests.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel - NOT a 5 STAR - Please AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: GOHILS01
Reviews.Content: I went and stayed at Eurostar from the 29th April until 2nd May 2011. The first night from 5pm no HOT water in the whole hotel until 8am on the Saturday. Towels were not changed nor were the bed sheets in 2 nights and to test this we stained the sheets and they still did not change on the 3rd day so we demanded to have them done. Dust filled room and very poor breakfast in the morning. No managers work on weekends so you can only complain on weekdays and FINALLY the one and only good thing the location... That is it. I have pictures to prove my point. This is a NO star hotel. The gym was dirty and so was the pool area... The list goes on. please avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To The Claimed Standard - Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: barbarawalshtravel
Reviews.Content: We booked our accommodation directly on the Eurostars website since they were promoting a special "pre-opening" deal. Unfortunately the hotel shows many signs of not yet being ready for its official opening. A number of other reviewers have made comments about issues such as how hard it is to locate the hotel from street level. We can only agree wholeheartedly about this. It wasn't until I'd walked half a block along Freidrichstrasse and happened to look back that I happened to glimpse the Hotel Eurostars name on a building above the s-bahn line. The hotel has no frontage at all onto Freidrichstrasse, despite it's address. We also found that the revolving doors failed to do so for much of our stay. Staff support for guests was not what one would expect from a supposedly 5 star property. We found that room cleaning didn't extend to replacing dirty glasses and mugs with clean ones, nor replacing toiletries or tea and coffee facilities, despite a request to the "customer service" line for this. Breakfast on our second morning at the hotel was a shambles. During the time we were attempting to enjoy our breakfast the buffet was out of milk (hot or cold), the empty scrambled eggs container wasn't refilled, both coffee machines ran out of supplies, as did several of the juices. It seems that there wasn't anybody actually responsible for telling the numerous waiting staff what needed to be done. The hotel does have some great possibilities with its excellent location adjacent to the Freidrichstrasse s-bahn and u-bahn stations, but much needs to be done before they can legitimately charge guests the rates available given the shortcomings that urgently need to be addressed by management.

Reviews.Title: “3 Stars Hotel at best...”
Reviews.Author: CustomerFromIsrael
Reviews.Content: First of all, The hotel is very hard to find by car or by walking, there are no signs and we couldn't find the address and neither could the dozens of locals we asked for help. When we called the hotel for guidance - there was no answer in the front desk. The rooms are very nice but are made of wood and it seems you can hear all your neighbours steps and moves and even when people are walking outside the corridor you hear them very loudly. Suprisingly the you can't hear the train outside so that's a plus. The breakfast is boring and has no variation, we spent 8 nights in the hotel and they served the exact things each time and it wasn't much. Also, the breakfast room is small considering the amount of guests and it is always crowded. Service is Mediocre at best and it seems most employees are Spanish and speak only spanish and a litlle german (Very bad english). Room Service is overpriced and meals are small and not satisfying. Pool is small and if more than 2 persons go inside it gets overcrowded. Plus - The hotel is very close to Bahnhof Berlin Friedrichstraße and we were able to reach any location quiet easily and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars, definitely not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: parpar3
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positive aspects of the Eurostars Berlin: The hotel is centrally located, next to the train and underground station Friedrichstrasse, thus easily and fast accessible from the airports Tegel and Schoenefeld. Many of Berlin's attractions are within walking distance. Unfortunately, this is the end of my positive feedback. The hotel was opened only two weeks before my stay, so much was still not running smoothly and in no way corresponds to the advertised 5 stars. It started when I was trying to enter the hotel, with the automatic revolving door not working. At the reception, it seems only native Spaniards are working (the hotel is part of a Spanish chain - all the labels in the hotel are also written in Spanish, in addition to German and English), whose German skills certainly need some improvement, at least if it goes beyond simple vocabulary. That may also be the reason for the lack of courtesy. The check-in was rather slow and inefficient. Since my reservation was not listed in the computer, the employee disappeared in the back office for 10 minutes and left me waiting - without a word of apology for the waiting time. The rooms are nice and stylish, but too conservative for my taste. As the hotel was fully booked, they put me in a room accessible for the handicapped, with a bathroom that simply must be described as bad design. The sink was small and had almost no storage space and no towel holder next to it. The towels were hanging in the shower, so they already got wet during showering. The worst is the shower itself, which is not completely separated from the rest of the bathroom - between the door and glass wall was an opening of approx. 50 cm through which the water from the horizontal massage jets of the shower panel flooded the entire bathroom. The second major problem was the cleanliness. The surfaces of the room's furniture were covered with dust and lint, with piles of it under the bed. Also the carpet on the corridor was covered with lint. Apparently the hotel has not been cleaned properly since it’s opening. The daily room cleaning was limited to making beds and changing towels. They did not dust, clean the floor or the bathroom or empty the trash. Other shortcomings: In the gym there were no towels and disinfectant to remove the sweat of the previous user. The room was too hot - without a chance to drink a glass of water. The lockers in the spa area were all locked although only a few guests were present. Therefore, towels and personal items had to be put on the floor or taken along in the pool or the sauna. Quite OK (though not exceptional) was the breakfast. However, the breakfast room is designed much too small, so it can get pretty loud and crowded when the hotel is fully occupied. Overall, I can only hope that many of the shortcomings are due to start-up problems and are eliminated over time. Besides the good location, you can currently find many better alternatives in Berlin, also in the 4 star category.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Berlin Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Friedrichstrasse 99, 10117 Berlin, Germany
